intro: Cycladenia humilis var. jonesii, commonly known as Jones' low bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Cycladenia humilis var. jonesii is a low-growing perennial that blooms in early spring, adding a subtle yet vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
